serous otitis media.context: Serous otitis media, better known as middle ear fluid, is the most common condition causing hearing loss in children.

hearing loss.context: Serous otitis media, better known as middle ear fluid, is the most common condition causing hearing loss in children.

fluid.context: This space can become filled with fluid during colds or upper respiratory infections.

colds.context: This space can become filled with fluid during colds or upper respiratory infections.

upper respiratory infections.context: This space can become filled with fluid during colds or upper respiratory infections.

speech delay.context: Because children need hearing to learn speech, hearing loss from fluid in the middle ear can result in speech delay.

ear infection.context: Most children will have at least one ear infection before the age of four.

mild conductive hearing loss.context: Usually, the presence of fluid results in a "mild conductive hearing loss."

antibiotics.context: This may consist of additional antibiotics, decongestants, and in some cases, nasal sprays.

decongestants.context: This may consist of additional antibiotics, decongestants, and in some cases, nasal sprays.

nasal sprays.context: This may consist of additional antibiotics, decongestants, and in some cases, nasal sprays.

surgical drainage.context: If fluid has been present for over 12 weeks, surgical drainage of the fluid is often indicated.

myringotomy and tubes.context: The procedure, medically termed a myringotomy and tubes, or tympanostomy and tube, (BMT if Bilateral) or PET (Pressure Equalizing Tubes), is performed on children under general anesthesia.
